title: Welcome To STEM MA Quantitative methods in Educational Research Blog
text:
We will use this blog to display student work from the MA STEM Quantitative methods in Educational Research

# Create a dataframe of country latitude and longitude data
world_data <- map_data(map="world")

# Create a dataframe of mean PISA science scores, and rename CNT to region
# for the leftjoin mergining of dataframes
WorldSci<-PISA_2018%>%
  select(CNT, PV1SCIE)%>%
  group_by(CNT)%>%
  summarise(meanSci=mean(PV1SCIE, na.rm=TRUE))%>%
  rename(region=CNT)

levels(WorldSci$region)[levels(WorldSci$region)=="United Kingdom"] <- "UK"
levels(WorldSci$region)[levels(WorldSci$region)=="United States"] <- "USA"
levels(WorldSci$region)[levels(WorldSci$region)=="B-S-J-Z (China)"] <- "China"
levels(WorldSci$region)[levels(WorldSci$region)=="Russian Federation"] <- "Russia"


Viet<-PISA_2018%>%
  select(PV1SCIE, CNT)%>%
  filter(CNT=="Vietnam")
  
# Add the country latitude and longitude data to the PISA scores
WorldSci<-left_join(world_data, WorldSci, by="region")
# Use geom_map to plot the basic world map (fill is white, line colour is black)
# Use geom_polygon to plot the PISA data
# Add a colour scale

Labels<-WorldSci%>%
  group_by(region)%>%
  summarise(meanSci=mean(meanSci), lat=mean(lat), long=mean(long))%>%
  na.omit()



ggplot(data = WorldSci, aes(x=long, y=lat, group=group)) +
  geom_map(data=world_data, map=world_data, aes(map_id=region), fill="white", colour="black")+
  geom_polygon(aes(fill=meanSci)) +
  scale_fill_viridis_c(option = "viridis")+
  geom_text_repel(data=Labels, inherit.aes = F, aes(x=long, y=lat,label=region),
                  size=3)+
  ggtitle("Mean PISA scoures by country")+
  theme(plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5))

title: About
text: The blog for the KCL MA STEM Quantitative Methods in Educational Research Module. This blog will display student work produced in R.

title: MASTEMQuant
text: This is a page to show student work from the MA STEM Quantitative Methods in Educational Research Module

title: MASTEMQuant
text: This is a page to show student work from the MA STEM Quantitative Methods in Educational Research Module

title: MASTEMQuant
text:
Example code

# Create a UK subset
PISAUK<-PISA_2018%>%
  filter(CNT=="United Kingdom")%>%
  select(PV1SCIE, PV1MATH)
# Plot scores, but add them to bins to reduce over ploting
# Set a colour scale to show number in bins
ggplot(PISAUK, aes(x=PV1MATH, y=PV1SCIE))+
  stat_bin2d(bins = 90) +
  scale_fill_gradient(low = "lightblue", high = "red", limits = c(0, 80))+
  ggtitle("UK PISA Science and Mathematics scores")+
  labs(x="Mathematics score", y="Science Score")

title: P8Data20222023
text:
library(BayesFactor)

Loading required package: coda


Loading required package: Matrix



Attaching package: 'Matrix'


The following objects are masked from 'package:tidyr':

    expand, pack, unpack


************
Welcome to BayesFactor 0.9.12-4.5. If you have questions, please contact Richard Morey (richarddmorey@gmail.com).

Type BFManual() to open the manual.
************

subset<-dfe2023%>%
  select(P8MEA,PTFSM6CLA1A, PTEALGRP2, PSENE4)
subset$P8MEA<-as.numeric(subset$P8MEA)

Warning: NAs introduced by coercion

subset$PTFSM6CLA1A<-parse_number(subset$PTFSM6CLA1A)

Warning: 1554 parsing failures.
row col expected actual
  1  -- a number     NP
  2  -- a number     NP
  3  -- a number     NP
  7  -- a number     NP
  8  -- a number     NP
... ... ........ ......
See problems(...) for more details.

subset$PTEALGRP2<-parse_number(subset$PTEALGRP2)

Warning: 1567 parsing failures.
row col expected actual
  1  -- a number     NP
  2  -- a number     NP
  3  -- a number     NP
  7  -- a number     NP
  8  -- a number     NP
... ... ........ ......
See problems(...) for more details.

subset$PSENE4<-parse_number(subset$PSENE4)

Warning: 1 parsing failure.
 row col expected actual
4881  -- a number   SUPP

subset<-subset%>%
  na.omit()
models<-regressionBF(P8MEA ~ ., data = subset)

Warning: data coerced from tibble to data frame

output<-as.data.frame(models@bayesFactor)

ggplot(output, aes(x=reorder(rownames(output), - bf), y=bf, fill=rownames(output)))+
  geom_col() +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 90, vjust = 0.5, hjust=1))

title: P8Data20222023
section: Grouped Scatter plot with marginal density plots
text:
Grouped Scatter plot with marginal density plots

library(ggpubr)

# Grouped Scatter plot with marginal density plots

plotdata<-dfe2023%>%
  filter(ICLOSE==0)%>%
  filter(P8MEA!="NP")%>%
  filter(P8MEA!="NE")%>%
  filter(P8MEA!="SUPP")%>%
  select(P8MEA, PTFSM6CLA1A, ADMPOL,SCHNAME)%>%
  na.omit()%>%
  mutate(label=ifelse(P8MEA>1.3,SCHNAME,""))%>%
  mutate(ADMPOL=ifelse(ADMPOL=="NR","Not recorded",
                       ifelse(ADMPOL=="SEL","Selective", 
                              ifelse(ADMPOL=="NSE","Not selective", NA))))

plotdata$PTFSM6CLA1A<-parse_number(plotdata$PTFSM6CLA1A)

ggscatterhist(data=plotdata, y="P8MEA", x="PTFSM6CLA1A",
              color ="ADMPOL", size = 0.5, alpha = 0.4,
              margin.params = list(fill = "ADMPOL", color = "black", size = 0.2),
              ggtheme = theme_bw())
